attributes.action: A short stay disability parking pass for people urgently needing toilet access
attributes.background: 100,000’s people in the UK have bowel or bladder condition which means they urgently have to use a toilet.  Sufferers often don’t make it to a toilet in time due to not being able to park in an accessible parking spot because they do not qualify for a disabled car parking badge.
attributes.additional_details:
Sufferers would only need to use the parking pass for the time when they urgently need a toilet.  They would then be able to move their vehicle to a standard parking spot.

Having a short stay pass for those times when they suddenly need access to a toilet would significantly improve the independence & quality of life for a person living with a long term bowel or bladder condition that affects their levels of continence.

attributes.action: Allow curry houses to bring in migrant staff for minimum UK wage
attributes.background: Curry business are penalised in the UK by an unrealistic salary threshold policy of £29750.00. Staff shortages in the industry means many business are closing down. UK should allow curry business bring knowledgeable staff from abroad for practical salaries to protect small businesses.
attributes.additional_details: It is not possible to train someone local in a short time to cook at a commercial standard. Imposing an affordable salary to recruit overseas trained staff helps curry business to stay in the market. To protect from illegal workers, govt. can introduce laws requiring compulsory full-time work, limited stay, and fixed amount deposit to ensure that illegal workers return before the end of their stay. Reducing illegal workers will make a large contribution to UK HM Revenue and tax.

attributes.action: Incentivise the use of the river Thames as a transport mode for freight
attributes.background:
Having operated vessels on the Thames, I am saddened by the surrounding decline of practical opportunities for utilising our glorious river sustainably for freight.

We must ask government to assess whether enough resource is available for industry to thrive and prefer water transport over road.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, yet again commuters using the M25 are stranded due to a HGV freight collision closing the QEII bridge.
Whilst this may seem unrelated, our small vessels pass underneath, with nearly no other vessels in site for miles.
A free, reliable transport mode able to move thousands of tonnes a day and relieve the neighbouring roads of HGV movements.
Why is more not being done to retain the use of the waterways?  Shipyards are in decline.  Skills are in decline.  We must act, before it is too late

attributes.action: Ban the sale of natural cotton bedding for small animals as it is highly unsafe.
attributes.background: Natural Cotton bedding has been the cause of at least 6 hamster deaths in the last 4 weeks that I personally know of. Deaths are caused by Entanglement and suffocation due to the fibres blocking access to the airways in the throat.  This is a priority issue amongst hamster owners.
attributes.additional_details: You can check hamster central forums and any face book hamster group for evidence and heart wrenching accounts from owners who have awoken to find their hamsters passed on due to entanglement or suffocation.  I have read two accounts of new owners struggling to try and save their hamsters from suffocating as the bedding had lodged in the throat, sadly they were unsuccessful.

attributes.action: Make all BBC board of directors all subject to election by UK electorate
attributes.background: To ensure those in ultimate charge of BBC ensure what it broadcasts or publishes is genuinely unbiased have a board of directors that is periodically subject to election by proportional representation by the general UK electorate

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medical and recreational use.
attributes.background:
Legalise cannabis for medical and recreational use.
It is time for the government to accept that cannabis should be legal. Prohibition has done nothing to reduce drug use and it is hypocritical for the government to allow alcohol and tobacco

attributes.action: Full ban on the purchase of fireworks & displays.
attributes.background: Firework explosions are producing blind panic in animals that are lead to serious injury, deep-rooted, debilitating fears and death. The explosion of fireworks also releases poisonous chemicals and particle-laden smoke, contaminating our natural environment. A ban on public use will simply not work.
attributes.additional_details:
The explosion of a firework which can emit sounds of up to 190 decibels, a full 110 to 115 decibels higher than the 75- to 80-decibel range, where damage to the human ear begins & is proportionately more disturbing to for an animal. 

There is an evident need to protect both companion animals and wild animals from fireworks harm, and this need is growing with each passing year. A ban on public use only protects domesticated animals and forget about wildlife.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medicinal purposes
attributes.background:
Evidence has shown that the use of CBD products improve help in cancer patients, people who suffer from severe epilepsy’s, MS and Parkinson’s desease
It’s time for action

attributes.action: NHS Allocation of Funds for PFO Closure in Selected Ischaemic Stroke Patients
attributes.background: Young and unsuspecting people suffer from stroke due to a hole in their heart called a PFO. There is a straight forward procedure scientifically proven to be statistically significant in reducing secondary stroke in these patients. The NHS does not currently allocate funding for this procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some links to relevant research: 

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/69/11_Supplement/1260

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/56/13_Supplement/B108.3

Professional boxer Dan Sarkozi is an example of an unsuspecting victim of cryptogenic stroke. Dan suffered a cryptogenic stroke due to a hole in his heart which was originally believed to be a PFO. He faced the proposition of losing his career and spending his life on blood thinning medication due to lack of funding for this procedure.

attributes.action: Make Dementia/Alzheimer's care completely funded by the NHS
attributes.background:
Full funding for the care of Alzheimer’s and Dementia patients should be covered by the NHS. Plenty of families face so many worries when a loved one goes into care and paying for their care shouldn’t be one of them. 
Please take a moment to sign my petition. 
Thank you.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence in the UK not to report discovering a death
attributes.background: Recently my brother passed away and the person who was staying with him never rang for help just left him on his own. I want to make this a criminal offence in the UK as it’s against the law in other countries. I need to get as many signatures as I can so no other family has to go through this.

attributes.action: Introduce a Deposit Return system for plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: 1 million bottles are purchased every second. Most are used for less than 30 mins. Less than half are recycled, and each takes 450 years to degrade, with increasing impacts on fossil fuels, the food chain and ecosystems. The UK should follow the lead from other countries.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic pollution is an urgent issue. Plastic production is set to increase rapidly by 2025, and the amount of plastic that can be recycled is very low. Consumers want change, but alternative options are limited.

Deposit schemes have been successful in other countries (e.g Germany, 97% are recycled), and the UK should follow the lead.

attributes.action: Allow women to breastfeed anywhere in the House of Commons
attributes.background: In the chamber of the House of Commons, women cannot breastfeed. The law allows women to breastfeed anywhere, so the House of Commons should be no exception - it's a bad example when the UK has low breastfeeding rates. It discriminates against MPs who breastfeed and against their constituents.

attributes.action: Stop uninsured drivers by increasing fines to £1000+
attributes.background:
In March 2018 we were hit by an uninsured driver. I was left with 7 broken bones, an operation, 7 days in hospital and the ongoing prospect of an 18 month recovery period.

The magistrates have banned the driver for 6 months and fined them just £120 for this offence.
attributes.additional_details: I ask for your support to get the Government to review the current fines imposed to be more reflective of the crime. £120 is less than the cost of most insurance cover and therefore not a deterrent. I propose a minimum fine of £1000+ to stop people driving without insurance.

attributes.action: Make the medical complaints process work for bereaved parents.
attributes.background: In 2013, my son died due to medical negligence. It has taken 4.5 long painful years to get answers and some kind of justice. The Government must review how medical complaints are handled and investigated to ensure that loved ones don’t have long and painful fights for the truth.
attributes.additional_details: Having a baby die is traumatic enough without having to put your grief on hold to fight for answers. We just need to know the truth. Clear procedures must be in place to ensure that we get the truth as quickly as possible. I really hope you can help me and other families who face the death of a child due to medical negligence.

attributes.action: Change law & sentences for child sex offenders and rapists.  children under 18
attributes.background: I have recently looked into many child rape cases, and found when an offender is convicted that they may get a life sentence, and serve only 10 to 15 years of the term and be eligible for parole before the sentence term ends. I would like to have this sentence changed.
attributes.additional_details: Life meaning life to any child sex offenders with no parole and a life meaning life sentence not to be walking the streets again.

attributes.action: Tax manufacturers and suppliers distributing Single Use Plastics beyond 2020
attributes.background: Following the success of documentaries such as Blue Planet, it has become clearer the deadly state single use plastics has on our environment. The government should look at taxing the problem at source to encourage companies to research breakthrough in sustainable, biodegradable alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.plasticfreechallenge.org/what-is-single-use-plastic/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-45232167

https://ieep.eu/archive_uploads/2128/IEEP_ACES_Product_Fiche_Single_Use_Plastics_Final_October_2016.pdf

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.radiotimes.com/news/tv/2018-08-29/blue-planet-2-plastic-waste-final-episode/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/abcnews.go.com/amp/International/great-pacific-garbage-patch-massive-floating-island-plastic/story%3fid=53962147

attributes.action: Require dog friendly or dog accessible stiles on every public footpath
attributes.background:
The law doesn’t require stiles to be ‘dog friendly’ as it’s the dog’s keeper who has the right of passage. 
A dog is a natural accompaniment to walkers which is recognised by land owners/ councils when signs such as ‘dog on leash’ are used but dogs are not accommodated when it comes to stiles.
attributes.additional_details: How many dog owners have had to carry their 5stone plus dog over a stile??? We need this change in the law as we are being encouraged to get out into the countryside and see more of our beautiful country

attributes.action: Debate providing funds to the NHS for Facial Feminisation Surgery
attributes.background: We the undersigned would like to ask the House of Commons to debate providing funding for Facial Feminisation Surgery on the NHS for Transwomen. As currently without funding many Transwomen are at risk due to a over masculinized face due to long term Testosterone development to the facial skeleton.
attributes.additional_details:
While the procedure would be aesthetic in nature, it would be in treating this condition to allow Transwomen to live free of anxiety and fear of attack/discrimination in everyday life.

This would parallel chest surgery for Transmen that is currently funded by the NHS.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facial_feminization_surgery

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/gender-dysphoria/treatment/

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/trans-hate-crimes-stats-figures-2017-more-than-third-a8166826.html

attributes.action: Ban all new fossil fuel vehicles by 2030
attributes.background: The UK Government has committed to banning new diesel and petrol cars by 2040. This is too late. The Clean Growth Strategy and legally binding carbon budgets require policies & action on major emitters and transport is now the largest contributing sector to UK emissions and causes air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/mar/18/uk-should-bring-2040-petrol-and-diesel-car-ban-forward-2030-green-alliance

https://www.theccc.org.uk/2018/01/17/uks-ambitious-clean-growth-strategy-must-translated-urgently-action/

http://www.green-alliance.org.uk/resources/How_the_UK_can_lead_the_electric_vehicle_revolution.pdf

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-40723581

attributes.action: Require employers to protect employees with food allergies at work
attributes.background: The government must make a specific law making it clear that employers have a legal duty to protect employees with serious food allergies.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of people are uneducated about food allergies and the severity of them. A work place should be a safe and comfortable environment but for many people like myself this lack of knowledge means these foods may be brought in, causing a risk of anaphylaxis, a life-threatening condition.
 
Employers should ensure staff are creating a safe environment for their colleagues and this includes not consuming foods that others have severe allergies too, this can be done by educating people on allergies and anaphylaxis. I have been working for a company for 5 years and still have colleagues who eat nuts around me causing me to go in to anaphylactic shock.

attributes.action: Make a law for causing serious injury by careless driving with severe penalties
attributes.background: My son received catastrophic life changing injuries in a RTA. The CPS could only charge the driver with careless driving and nothing more serious. All he got was £750 fine and 8 points, the most the judge could impose. There needs to be a law for causing serious injury by careless driving.
attributes.additional_details: There are stiff penalties for death caused by careless driving, serious injury caused by dangerous driving but there is nothing for serious injury caused by careless driving. This is not just, people are getting away with a slapped wrist, there is no deterrent to make people think before driving carelessly. People’s lives are being turned upside down and the judges are powerless to impose stiffer penalties. This has to be changed.

attributes.action: Create a veteran status with special benefits
attributes.background:
These benefits are to include: 
A higher tier housing allowance and priority over available homes. 
Food and amenities monthly allowance. 
Free public transport. 
0% Tax on PAYE or anything purchased in the UK. 
0.00 to be paid in council tax upon receiving Veteran status.
attributes.additional_details: Also investment by the government for Veteran communities in the UK, where Veterans can live and support each other, with access to Veteran medical and Dental care, Care workers for the elderly and counselling which is required to have a mandatory 6 monthly or yearly check-up.

attributes.action: Ban the use of slug pellets in the UK.
attributes.background: Many pesticides are potentially dangerous to hedgehogs and slug pellets are no exception.  Hedgehogs may eat the pellets, and they are very likely to eat the poisoned slugs and snails. As hedgehogs are an endangered species, pellets should be banned in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Hedgehogs are continuing to decline in the UK, according to a new report.Surveys by citizen scientists show hedgehog numbers have fallen by up to 95% since the turn of the century.
Conservation groups say they are particularly concerned about the plight of the hedgehog in towns and rural areas.Slug pellets contribute to this number.Hedgehogs are an endangered species we must do all we can to help these mammals.
There are many natural ways to curb slugs without the need for dangerous pellets.

attributes.action: Reduce all fares on Govia Trains by 25% until the service promised is delivered.
attributes.background: The Rail2020 plan was meant to help all those people who live outside London to have a better, more frequent and reliable service. It was promised that there would be more trains during peak times and a better service.  until the service delivers what it promised all fares should be reduced by 25%.

attributes.action: Raise concerns with the French Government regards concert on Sword beach
attributes.background: Prevent / reconsider "The International Concert for Freedom" being on held on Sword beach in Normandy; A recognised scene of Battle on D-Day 1944. A location where veterans / families return to pay respects, the remains of former veterans (Ashes) are laid and where the fallen remain.
attributes.additional_details: On the 6th June 2019, the 75th commemorations of the Normandy landings. It is proposed by the Ouistreham commune , the Calvados department in Normandy with the organisers of "The International Concert for Freedom" to hold a concert under the guise of a commemorative event. On the beaches designated Sword beach on D-Day. The organisers predict 1 million guests. This petition is to prevent the concert been held on this sensitive area /scene of battle and reconsider its location.

attributes.action: Stop anti-abortion campaigners from protesting outside hospitals
attributes.background: Every day, women in the UK face the hard decision to terminate a pregnancy. If this wasn’t already difficult enough, the prospect of “pro-life” campaigners picketing outside the hospital, sometimes can be enough to prohibit women from accessing the care they need due to shame, embarrassment or guilt
attributes.additional_details:
In a country where abortion is legal, why do we allow the “passive harrassment” of pro-life campaigners outside of hospital and health care settings.

Everyone is allowed to have their opinion and protest for what they believe in, but this should be nowhere near a hospital, where people are facing these heartbreaking decisions. It is inappropriate and immoral. Please help us change this, so women in the UK will not be forced to take dangerous actions to terminate pregnancy.

attributes.action: Halt the rollout of Universal Credit
attributes.background:
Universal Credit is having a massive impact on families in our country.
Cuts to the funding have forced many people into poverty and relying on food banks.
We believe the Government should halt the rollout of Universal Credit until the funding is fully restored.
Halt the rollout now!

attributes.action: Avoid no deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has let us down with its negotiations with the EU and we are heading for a no deal scenario, which leaders in all fields say will be hugely damaging to the UK in many areas of life, from health to air travel to food imports. We must avoid a no deal situation.
attributes.additional_details: We need to accept we need more time to organise our departure from the EU and request an extension to the article 50 process. This will give the UK time to continue talks, hold an general election or seek further opinion from the public to determine how Brexit should proceed.  Most importantly we will avoid a damaging no deal scenario which will harm poor and vulnerable people the most

attributes.action: Force all Govia Rail Franchises to freeze ticket prices for at least one year.
attributes.background: Since the introduction of the Govia Thameslink Rail Plan 20/20 timetable, we the long suffering commuters, have had to endure a train service not fit for purpose. There are numerous social media accounts of stranded passengers, overcrowding, and services cancelled with little or no notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Only when pressurised by the Commons Select Committee, did Govia Thameslink admit to knowing in advance, that their Rail Plan 20/20 timetable wouldn’t work. They didn’t have enough fully trained drivers or a balanced staff roster in place. 

What is unforgivable is their total disregard for their passengers, and the mental and physical distress this is causing. 

The Department of Transport should instruct Govia to freeze all ticket price increases for a period of not less than one year.

attributes.action: Seek an Independent Inquiry into the death of Kishni Mahay
attributes.background: For the last 29 years our family have vigorously believed that a gross injustice has reigned over my mother’s death. An unbiased Independent inquiry would conclusively reveal justice and bring Kishni Mahay dignity in death. She will be able to rest in peace and we can achieve the closure we yearn.
attributes.additional_details: Kishni Mahay was killed by a police patrol car. We believe that the car was not being driven appropriately according to the road conditions. We believe that key facts were missed by the investigating team (Police Complaints Authority: PCA). The Police Officer was never prosecuted. The post mortem examination declared that Kishni Mahay was an alcoholic with Cirrhosis of the Liver, which may have confused the inquest jurors.

attributes.action: New EU membership referendum asking leave or remain until 55% majority reached
attributes.background: Given there are controversies, divisions and near impasse after the narrow simple majority in 2016 EU referendum to leave, with more information available Parliament to restore pre 2016 status and legislate for new same referendum until a minimum 55% threshold is reached by either side
attributes.additional_details: The 1974 referendum to join EU had 67% majority but 2016 EU referendum to leave was decided by a narrow simple majority of 51.9% leaving bitterness and deep divisions as both sides accuse the other of misleading the public. A divided nation fears walking into an unknown future. With clearer information now on consequences of remain or leave the 2016 outcome be set aside and another referendum could unite people behind a decisive outcome until a minimum majority of 55% of those voting is reached.

attributes.action: End dog on dog attacks
attributes.background:
Currently there is no law to protect our dogs which is enforced, when a dog attacks or kills another dog. 
The government need to update the dangerous dogs act 1991 and make the owners liable for prosecution if an attack happens.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 19th August 2018 our blind 14yr old toy poodle was savagely attacked by two American bulldogs. She was playing in the long grass when the two dogs saw movement and hunted her. The dogs were too strong and she couldn’t be saved. 
We need to fight to save all other dogs lives from dangerous dogs which are not correctly restrained. 
We can’t bring Emma or the other dogs who have lost their lives back but we can try and change the future. 
#EmmasLaw

attributes.action: If there is a vote on the final EU deal then there must be no option to stay in
attributes.background: If there is a referendum on the final deal with the EU then the options must be simply deal or no deal. There must be no option to stay a member of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: It was clearly stated in the pro EU booklet: 'This is your decision. The government will implement what you decide.'   The once in a generation decision on whether we want to be in the EU or not has already been made, we voted to leave and that must be respected either way whether or not we can get a good deal and there must be no option to stay a member in any vote on the final deal.

attributes.action: Make a crime that is motivated by prejudice against homelessness a hate crime.
attributes.background: Homeless people are some of the most vulnerable members of society, but face the risk of physical and verbal attacks by members of the public daily. Homeless people are at risk of having their possessions stolen and subjected to emotional abuse just because they live in absolute poverty.
attributes.additional_details: These are people who are discriminated against because they are affected by poverty. They should be protected by the same laws that protect people from other kinds of hate crimes.

attributes.action: To provide acceptable levels of border control staff & e-gates at UK airports
attributes.background: Visitors & UK residents arrive at UK airports to face queues of over two hours to enter the UK.  They face unmanned desks and e-gates closed or not working.  Visitors arriving to do business, invest or spend on holiday are given an appalling experience that is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: It is understood that the government has not been prepared to invest in the e-gates or manning of Border Force desks, leaving airports, airlines and ultimately the public to either pick up the bill or leave the facilities empty resulting in queues and unhappy investors in the UK economy.  Border Force must be properly funded, properly managed and a credit to the UK.  First impressions are lasting impressions, a two hour queue is the latter.

attributes.action: Allow carers who have SGO/parental responsibility paid time off work
attributes.background: We are currently fostering a baby under kinship care however looking at applying for special guardianship and need to be able to give him the time he deserves without being penalised financially
attributes.additional_details: You get paid leave from work if you give birth to a child or adopt a child.  If you gain parental responsibly any other way eg SGO which comes under the adoption act there is no paid time to bond, get them settled in thier forever home and for the new parents.  These children and parents have the same rights responsibilities and needs of any parent/child often more so depending on the child's background.  I believe there should be leave similar to adoption leave allowed in these circumstances.

attributes.action: Do NOT introduce the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' to the UK. Decriminalise instead!
attributes.background: The proposed implementation in the UK of the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' in regards to sex buyer laws criminalises the client and not the sex worker. However, this criminalisation punishes the sex worker by abolishing their market and source of income, whilst making trafficked women harder to find.
attributes.additional_details: Sex workers and women who are forced to sell sex are two separate groups.Yet the Nordic Model assumes that the act of buying sex is inherently violent towards women,this is wrong.Currently for sex workers it's (and should always be),the individual's choice who to have sex with and/or charge for sex. A separate market exists for trafficked women & children and a blanket ban won't help. http://theconversation.com/the-nordic-model-of-prostitution-law-is-a-myth-21351

attributes.action: A residency qualification of 5 years to sufficient for full UK voting rights.
attributes.background: My Swedish wife has been here for 36 years and is barred from voting in GEs and referenda. This is an affront to any acceptable standard of democracy. She works and pays taxes here, and has had a National Insurance Number for many years. Sign if you can see that this is deeply undemocratic.
attributes.additional_details: It is simple. There should be no taxation without representation, and people who have shown their commitment to the UK for 5 years or more are, in my view, entitled to have a say in how the country is governed. Anything else is clearly unfair, undemocratic, and unacceptable.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of filtered cigarettes across the UK.
attributes.background: It is widely accepted that cigarette filters have little to no health benefits for smokers. Many understand that cigarette filters contain large amounts of toxic chemicals but most people do not realise they contain plastic and are the biggest ocean pollutant on the planet.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 4.5 trillion cigarette butts find their way into the environment every single year. It's estimated that a cigarette butt will take 10-12 years to break down.

By banning cigarette filters we could eliminate a massive percentage of plastic/litter finding its way to our streets, rivers and oceans almost overnight benefiting us, wildlife and the environment. It's likely to encourage more smokers to give up too.

attributes.action: Railcard for armed forces veterans
attributes.background: As a serving member of the armed forces a railcard is available for purchase which provides for 33% off rail fares. A veterans' railcard should also be introduced giving the same benefit.

attributes.action: Abolish the out dated 'ONE MILE RULE' in the dispensing of medication in England
attributes.background: A Dickensian rule was set in the early nineteen hundreds which states that Doctors prescribe and Apothecaries dispense. Doctors could only dispense if the patient lived more than a mile from the Apothecary (as the crow flies) due to Doctors staff not being qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Now in the 21st century,Doctors dispensing staff are as qualified in all aspects of dispensing and services as the Chemists.The One Mile Rule should now be abolished to fit the NHS White Paper headed PATIENT CHOICE,so that ALL patients in practices throughout the country have the option to choose where they would like their medications dispensed be,it Retail,Online or Doctors Dispensaries.
Therefore by abolishing the ONE MILE RULE, the Government will adhere to the heading of the NHS White Paper

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares to anyone under 18, by law.
attributes.background: The legal age of adulthood is 18 in the UK. Yet many transport operators require children of a certain age to buy a full-fare ticket, intended for adults. Young people cannot work full-time and we should be supporting them, rather than offering fares which exploit and disadvantage children.
attributes.additional_details: Most trains in the UK are an example of how the fares system fails to support those who are in full-time education, and who are the future of our country. Fares continue to be structured as though it is the last century, when far less 16 and 17 year olds were in education. Both bus and train operators are guilty of exploiting young people, through fares and fines. A new law would create a sense of consistency and equality for all children using public transport in the UK.

attributes.action: Reform company car tax for diesel and ultra-low emission vehicles.
attributes.background:
Support UK fleets, businesses and drivers by:
- Reducing the 4% diesel company car tax levy until RDE2 testing is commonplace.
- Introduce the ULEV company car tax bands in April 2019, not 2020.
- Tax bands to at least 2022/23 are needed now, including how they will address higher WLTP figures.
attributes.additional_details: For more information about the benefits of the UK's company car sector, and why it needs additional support, click here: https://fleetworld.co.uk/save-the-company-car/

attributes.action: Reduce VAT and explore alternatives to business rates across the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Owner of Michelin-starred restaurant Pied-à-Terre, David Moore, wants action to be taken to save businesses and jobs with a thorough review of a sales tax as an alternative to business rates and a reduction on VAT for food sales.
attributes.additional_details: The restaurant businesses on the High Street which employ hundreds of thousands of people in the UK are trying to support their families all over the country and need urgent help to survive.

attributes.action: Stop the ageist segregation in minimum wage. Living costs are all the same.
attributes.background: Their are four segratory categories to minimum wage. 16-17, 18-20, 21-24 and over 25. The hourly minimum difference between what a 16 year old can earn to a 25 year old is £3.63. If they were working a full time week consisting of 40 hours thats an overall anual difference of £6,969.60.
attributes.additional_details: For a 16 and 25 year old working full time, doing the same job on minimum wage their annual differential income is £6,969.60. The guardian quotes: “A single person living in Britain needs to earn at least £13,400 a year before tax to afford a basic but acceptable standard of living” however for a sixteen year old on minimum wage working 40 hours per week will earn an average anual salary of £8,064. That’s only 60.17% of what is recommended for a stable income and living.

attributes.action: Please protect our treasured St Helens beach huts with Listed Structure status.
attributes.background:
8 October 2018 Isle of Wight County Press article "The Isle of Wight's historic railway carriage beach huts at centre of redevelopment discussions" http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16967980.the-isle-of-wights-historic-railway-carriage-beach-huts-at-centre-of-redevelopment-discussions/
 Save our beach!
attributes.additional_details: The beach huts alongside St Helens beach are old railway carriages and part of our national heritage. They deserve to be preserved and conserved against the whims and fancies of developers. Why should we have to destroy our village life to suit the tastes of developers? These beach huts are part of the "setting" of St Helens Fort, a scheduled monument and Listed Building Grade II. As such this should be considered as part of the Historic Environment and be properly protected by the Government.

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to reconsider its proposed marketing restrictions for P2P lenders
attributes.background: The recent proposed changes contained within the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)'s consultation on peer-to-peer lenders proposes that obstacles be placed in the way of investor involvement, unless investors can prove they are sophisticated, a HNW, a professional or under professional advisement.
attributes.additional_details:
Peer-to-peer lending was always meant to embody the idea that the old financial order was fundamentally not fit for purpose and needed renewal. For example if banks didn’t pass on interest rate rises to savers, online lenders would. And they have. 
The FCA should rethink its approach and trust the investor to make the right decision about what they do with their investments. Better regulation of peer to peer lending is required but narrowing down choice isn’t the right way to go.

attributes.action: Make cyclists have a registration plate, tax, Mot and insurance
attributes.background: We have been getting very heated with each other over push bikers. As if they crash into you and then they ride off there would be no proof of it or any way to prosecute them.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys in children’s fast food meals.
attributes.background: Fast food restaurants produce billions of non essential plastic toys every year to give away in children’s meals. The toys which are packed in plastic bags are usually thrown away before the children even leave the restaurant.
attributes.additional_details:
Children seem to enjoy the toys more than the meals but fast food outlets could change this by offering more variety and healthier choices. They could perhaps create paper comics as an alternative to the toys and these could be recycled. 
There is too much waste in the world and too much plastic going to landfill and ending up in our oceans. Fast food outlets would make a massive difference if they cared more about the plastic waste that they produce.
